comments.body: I realize it's not part of this PR, but I assume the OS should be Debian and the Networking should be custom or Docker? What sould config mgmt. be?

The mesos guide doesn't come with automated cluster deployment scripts. It describes a manual process. So there's no config management, operating system, or networking specified. They could all be N/A, but we left them blank instead.

But their size and availability is limited to that of a single machine.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +111,115 @@- [Kubernetes on Mesos](mesos.md) (Uses GCE)

## Table of Solutions
Here are all the solutions mentioned above in table form.

comments.body: Where are you planning to move the info about last version tested with each config?

I am not.  People can put this in the getting-started-guide if they really want to.

This was useful when kubernetes was changing rapidly.
However, it was not updated reliably.  Also, simply using
a particular binary version does not assure users that
the distribution provides a conformant implementation.
The conformance test does provide that, and I'm hoping
that more distros will use that in the future.
Therefore, I've deleted the Notes column in favor of the
Conforms column.

comments.body: Why indirect through the footnote? Why not just link directly?

1. so that the column just reads as either a checkmark or not.  More visual impact
2. to limit column width so it fits on screen, both rendered, and in text mode.
Oh, I guess only reason 2b is valid: so that the text version of the md has reasonable line length.
